author: Legal Correspondent
text:
The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked BJP leader Subramanian Swamy to amend his petition, seeking quashing of alliance between Jet Airways and Abu Dhabi-based Etihad Airways.

A Bench led by Chief Justice of India T.S. Thakur asked Dr. Swamy to change his petition by also challenging the bilateral agreement between India and United Arab Emirates on increasing the number of flights between the two countries.

A Bench comprising Chief Justice T.S. Thakur and Justice U.U. Lalit also asked Dr. Swamy to implead other airlines as parties to the list as they may also get affected if the court decides in favour or against the Jet-Etihad deal.
title: Amend plea on Jet-Etihad, SC tells Swamy
